question: Assuming that the variance of the simulations is large, if the variance is represented as V and is calculated to be 5.76, what is the standard deviation of the simulations?
solution:
The standard deviation (SD) is the square root of the variance (V).

SD = √V = √5.76 ≈ 2.4

Thus, the standard deviation of the simulations is 

\[
\boxed{2.4}
\]
